result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard J Ayala

records.addlTxt:
8:15 AM Defendant Richard J Ayala in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Richard J Ayala.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.

1:18 PM Defendant Richard J Ayala in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Attorney Andrew Herbers appears as friend of the court.  
Atty. Herbers states Atty. Kershek will be appointed to the case.  Defendant requests an adjournment to obtain private counsel.  Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived by defendants. Public defender to monitor until private counsel is retained.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on September 6, 2022

ADDRESS INFO for Richard J Ayala
Current: C/O Waukesha Co Jail, 515 W Moreland Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 09-02-2022)
Prior: 1325A W Mineral St, Milwaukee, WI 53204

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed to include a motorcycle. Comply with all licensing restrictions. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key with the exception of any 3rd party contact for insurance purposes. Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

1:40 PM Defendant Richard J Ayala in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Richard J Ayala. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
